alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Gloucester, northwestern York, southeastern New Kent, and James City Counties, the northern City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 230 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Toano, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Gloucester Courthouse, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Norge, Toano, Gloucester Point, Busch Gardens, Wicomico, York Terrace, Lee Hall, Carver Gardens, Grove, Kings Point, Barhamsville, Croaker, Lackey and Camp Peary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent; Newport News; York
